page.title: 14THE OLD FORGE COTTAGE
page.content: The Old Forge Cottage is situated in the Borough of Eastleigh.The outside of the house is painted white with Tudor style wooden beams.In the garden there is a Yew tree,it is shaped like a bell.It is 30 feet high and is trimed every year.The garden once contained two thatched stables,a few pigstyes,and a Black-smith's shop. Inside the cottage there are ten small rooms:a kitchen,a dairy, three bedrooms,a dining room,a study,a lounge,a hall and a loft room.Half of the lounge was the Black-smith's shop. Underneath the lounge floor there is a box which the present owner hid for people in the future to find.The contents are some pictures of the owner's family,a bus ticket,an old penny and an old pound note. Some of the walls are made of wattle and daub.
